definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Jesus was born in a stable and a manger was used as his bed.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣诞生在马厩内，马秣槽被用作他的床。

sentences.english: Our horse was bedded down in the barn by the stable boy.
sentences.chinese: 我们的马被小马夫安顿好在马厩里了。

sentences.english: The enemy desecrate the church by using it as a stable.
sentences.chinese: 敌人亵渎这所教堂，把它当做马厩。

sentences.english: The farmer have hoemploy the horse in the barn.
sentences.chinese: 农夫把他的马圈在马厩里。

sentences.english: I am from the King's barn, a much more majestic place than a manure pile.
sentences.chinese: 我是从国王的马厩里来的，那地方要比粪堆豪华得多。

sentences.english: Using an isolated horse barn, he sells his captives to the highest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 使用一个孤立的马厩，他出售他的俘虏以价高者得。

sentences.english: The young man thanked David's father and walked the donkey to the stable.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人谢过大卫的爸爸，然后牵着驴去了马厩。

sentences.english: Located on a mews lane in Rathmines it is sufficiently large to support a family over a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 位于马厩里拉思曼斯它大到足以支持一个家庭的一生。

sentences.english: A stable is the building in which horses are kept and fed.
sentences.chinese: 马厩就是养马和关马的地方。

sentences.english: He took his horse elsewhere, and sure enough the stable was burnt down.
sentences.chinese: 于是他将马牵去别的地方，马厩果然也烧毁了。

sentences.english: The horses dashed out of burning stable.
sentences.chinese: 马群猛冲出着了火的马厩。

sentences.english: Heathcliff had gone to loose the beast, and shift it to his own stall;
sentences.chinese: 希斯克利夫走上往解开马，把它系到自己的马厩里。

sentences.english: I know of nothing more calculated to make a man sick of this world than a stable yard on a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得再电没有比雨天的马厩院子更令人厌舸的了。

sentences.english: The farmer has housed the horse in the barn.
sentences.chinese: 农夫把他的马圈在马厩里。

sentences.english: When the farmers are finished, they take me to the stables.
sentences.chinese: 这些农民射了以后把我带到马厩。
